title: Covid-19 Vaccine Success Won't Eliminate Virus Risk, U.K. Concludes
author: Max Colchester; Jason Douglas
description: Disease modelers advising the U.K. government recently made a sobering projection: 56,000 more Covid-19 deaths by the summer of next year, even if the country tiptoes out of lockdown and the vaccines work.
cleaned_text: Updated Feb. 23, 2021 5:57 pm ET LONDON—By the middle of this year, all adults in Britain are due to be offered a Covid-19 vaccine in what is on course to be the fastest inoculation rollout in a major Western country. But disease modelers advising the U.K. government recently made a sobering projection: 56,000 more Covid-19 deaths by the summer of next year, even if the country tiptoes out of lockdown and the vaccines work.
